analyzed: ji skad smos pa 'di las ma gtogs pa'i lhag ma sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba ni /

analyzed: phyi rol gyi sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba kho na zhes bya'o //

translated: He gives himself to those who want a master, and he gives his hands, feet, eyes, head, limbs, members, flesh, blood, and even to the marrow, to those who want hands, feet, eyes, head, limbs, members, flesh, blood, and even marrow.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam pa gnyis kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po sems can rnams la yongs su gtong ste ci bder longs spyod du gzhug pa'i phyir brnyan por sbyin pa dang / de dbang bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad du btang ba'i sems kyis sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam pa gnyis kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po sems can rnams la yongs su gtong ste ci bder longs spyod du gzhug pa'i phyir brnyan por sbyin pa dang / de dbang bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad du btang ba'i sems kyis sbyin par byed de /
translated: Bodhisattvas give external things to sentient beings in two ways: they give them as a loan, so that they may enjoy them as they wish; and they give them with a mind that has let go of them completely, so that they may become their property.

original: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad bye brag med par rnam pa thams cad du sems can rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad bye brag med par rnam pa thams cad du sems can rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //

analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis las ci zhig ni sems can rnams la sbyin par byed /
translated: What then does the bodhisattva give to sentient beings out of the two kinds of things, internal and external?

original: ci zhig ni sbyin par mi byed /
analyzed: ci zhig ni sbyin par mi byed /
translated: What does he not give?

original: ji ltar ni sbyin par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar ni sbyin par byed /
translated: How does he give?

original: ji ltar ni sbyin par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar ni sbyin par mi byed ce na /
translated: How does he not give?

analyzed: phan par mi 'gyur ba'am / yang na bde bar yang mi 'gyur la / phan par yang mi 'gyur ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la sbyin par mi byed do // sbyin pa gang phan par ni 'gyur la / bde bar 'gyur ba ni ma nges pa'am /
translated: but not benefit,

original: yang na bde bar yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang na bde bar yang 'gyur la /
translated: or which would bring neither happiness nor benefit.

original: phan par yang 'gyur ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: phan par yang 'gyur ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la sbyin par byed de /
translated: He does give to others that gift which would bring benefit,üîΩeven though it may not bring happiness,üîΩor which would bring both happiness and benefit.

original: de ltar na 'di ni sbyin pa dang mi sbyin pa'i mdor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni sbyin pa dang mi sbyin pa'i mdor bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the summary of generosity and non-generosity.

original: 'di man chad ni rgyas pa rnam par dbye ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni rgyas pa rnam par dbye ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: From here on, it should be understood as the detailed analysis.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol la gnod par bya ba dang / pha rol la brid pa dang / mi rigs pas bskyed pas byed du bcug na pha rol gyi dbang du byed pa dang / pha rol la rag las par byed par bdag nyid sbyin par mi byed de /

translated: Here, the bodhisattva does not give himself to be controlled by others or to be dependent on others, by harming others, deceiving others, or causing others to do what is improper.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan dag la bdag nyid kyi srog lan brgya 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan dag la bdag nyid kyi srog lan brgya 'am /
translated: The bodhisattva does not agree to give his own life hundreds of times,

original: lan stong ngam /üîΩlan 'bu ma du yongs su gtong bar yang khas len med kyi /
analyzed: lan stong ngam / lan 'bu ma du yongs su gtong bar yang khas len med kyi /
translated: thousands of times,üîΩor even millions of times to others.

original: 'on kyang pha rol gyi bsgo ba dang / pha rol dga' bar bya ba'i phyir pha rol la gnod pa'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang pha rol gyi bsgo ba dang / pha rol dga' bar bya ba'i phyir pha rol la gnod pa'am /

analyzed: pha rol bsad @176b pa'am /
translated: killing others,

original: pha rol brid par mi byed do //
analyzed: pha rol brid par mi byed do //
translated: or deceiving others, the bodhisattva does not give himself to be controlled by others or to be dependent on others, even for the sake of pleasing others and being obedient to others.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa las brtsams te bsam pa dag pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa las brtsams te bsam pa dag pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: If the bodhisattva‚Äôs generosity is pure in intention,

original: de yang sems can gyi don bya ba mang po nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: de yang sems can gyi don bya ba mang po nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: but many tasks for the sake of sentient beings are to be done,

original: rang gi lus dang / yan lag dang nyid lag slong ba byung yang rang gi lus dang yan lag dang nyid lag rnams sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: rang gi lus dang / yan lag dang nyid lag slong ba byung yang rang gi lus dang yan lag dang nyid lag rnams sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: then even if a request is made for his body, limbs, or appendages, he does not give his body, limbs, or appendages.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa las brtsams te bsam pa dag pa de ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang 'di ni sbyin no //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa las brtsams te bsam pa dag pa de ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang 'di ni sbyin no //
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di la ni sbyin no snyam du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di la ni sbyin no snyam du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the bodhisattva‚Äôs generosity is pure in intention, and he does not have a mind that is discouraged by any means, thinking, ‚ÄúI will give this,üîΩand I will give to this one.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ni gang gi tshe bsam pa dag par bya ba'i phyir sems can gyi dgos pa byung ba btang snyoms su byas te sbyin par mi byed na /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ni gang gi tshe bsam pa dag par bya ba'i phyir sems can gyi dgos pa byung ba btang snyoms su byas te sbyin par mi byed na /
translated: Therefore, when the bodhisattva, in order to purify his intention, ignores the needs of sentient beings and does not give,

original: de ni de'i bsam pa dag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni de'i bsam pa dag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: that is pure in intention.

original: sems can gyi dgos pa byung ba btang snyoms su byas te sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: sems can gyi dgos pa byung ba btang snyoms su byas te sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: He does not ignore the needs of sentient beings and then give.

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnam par tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas slong du 'ongs pa rnams la yang de dag nyid la gnod pa dang / phung po chen por mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir rang gi lus dang yan lag gse zhing sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnam par tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas slong du 'ongs pa rnams la yang de dag nyid la gnod pa dang / phung po chen por mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir rang gi lus dang yan lag gse zhing sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: He does not give away his body and limbs to those who come to ask, in order to avoid harming them and to avoid a great heap of suffering, even though they are demons and gods of the demon class who have come to ask with the intention of harming him.

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the demons and gods of the demon class,

original: des bslabs pa'i sems can rnams la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des bslabs pa'i sems can rnams la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: so it is with sentient beings who have been trained by him.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni skyon pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa la yang rang gi lus dang / yan lag gse zhing sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni skyon pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa la yang rang gi lus dang / yan lag gse zhing sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give away his body and limbs to those who are insane or mentally disturbed.

original: de dag ni rang gi sems la gnas par yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi sems la gnas par yang ma yin la /
translated: They are not in their right mind.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir slong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir slong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not ask out of desire.

original: de ni de dag gi sems la rang dbang med pa'i phyir bla brdol tsam du zad pa de'i phyir sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi sems la rang dbang med pa'i phyir bla brdol tsam du zad pa de'i phyir sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: Since they are just babbling, they are not to be given, because their minds are not in control.

original: rnam pa de dag las ma gtogs par de dag las bzlog pa'i 'dod pa rnams la ni byang chub sems dpas rang gi lus pha rol dbang bar bya ba tsam gyi phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag las ma gtogs par de dag las bzlog pa'i 'dod pa rnams la ni byang chub sems dpas rang gi lus pha rol dbang bar bya ba tsam gyi phyir /
translated: Except for those cases, the bodhisattva, in order to make his own body a mere instrument for others,

original: yan lag dang nyid lag dag gse zhing yongs su gtong bar yang byed de /
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag dag gse zhing yongs su gtong bar yang byed de /
translated: will even barter and give away his major and minor body parts, in accordance with the wishes of others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni nang gi dngos po sbyin pa dang mi sbyin pa ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni nang gi dngos po sbyin pa dang mi sbyin pa ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is how the bodhisattva should be understood to give internal things.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po las ni byang chub sems dpas dug dang / me dang / mtshon cha dang / chang sems can rnams @177a * //üîΩla gnod par 'gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni bdag la gnod par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po las ni byang chub sems dpas dug dang / me dang / mtshon cha dang / chang sems can rnams @177a * // la gnod par 'gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni bdag la gnod par bya ba 'am /
translated: As for external things, the bodhisattva will not give poison, fire, weapons, or alcohol to sentient beings if they are harmful,üîΩwhether for the purpose of harming oneself or others.

original: pha rol la gnod par bya ba'i phyir 'dod de slong na /
analyzed: pha rol la gnod par bya ba'i phyir 'dod de slong na /
translated: If someone asks for these things

original: slong ba rnams la ni sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: slong ba rnams la ni sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: But he does not give to beggars.

original: dug dang me dang mtshon cha dang / chang sems can rnams la phan par 'gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpas bdag la phan par bya ba'am /
analyzed: dug dang me dang mtshon cha dang / chang sems can rnams la phan par 'gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpas bdag la phan par bya ba'am /
translated: If someone asks a bodhisattva for poison, fire, weapons, or alcohol, with the intention of harming himself or others,üîΩthe bodhisattva does not give it to him.

original: pha rol la phan par bya ba'i phyir 'dod de slong na /
analyzed: pha rol la phan par bya ba'i phyir 'dod de slong na /
translated: But if someone asks a bodhisattva for these things with the intention of helping himself or others,

original: slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva gives them to the beggar.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol yid brtan pa ma yin pa'i rdzas kyang gzhan dag la sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol yid brtan pa ma yin pa'i rdzas kyang gzhan dag la sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: A bodhisattva does not give things to others that are not fit to be used, even if they are asked for.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni smyan byed cing pha rol gyi chung ma bkug ste gzhan dag la sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni smyan byed cing pha rol gyi chung ma bkug ste gzhan dag la sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: A bodhisattva does not give the wife of one person to another, even if asked.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba srog chags dang bcas pa yang sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba srog chags dang bcas pa yang sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: A bodhisattva does not give food or drink that contains living organisms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gang dga' ba dang / rtse ba dang ldan pa sems can rnams la gnod pa dang ldan pa de yang byang chub sems dpas slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gang dga' ba dang / rtse ba dang ldan pa sems can rnams la gnod pa dang ldan pa de yang byang chub sems dpas slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give to petitioners things that are objects of enjoyment and play, but that are harmful to sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de byin na de dag byang chub sems dpa' la sems dga' ba tsam skye bar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de byin na de dag byang chub sems dpa' la sems dga' ba tsam skye bar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Because when he gives them, although the bodhisattva‚Äôs mind is filled with joy,

original: 'on kyang sbyin pa de ni de la gnod pa ches che bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sbyin pa de ni de la gnod pa ches che bar byed pa yin te /
translated: that gift causes them great harm.

original: de'i rgyus de rgyags pa dang / bag med pa dang / nyes par spyod pa la zhugs pas lus zhig nas ngan song dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyus de rgyags pa dang / bag med pa dang / nyes par spyod pa la zhugs pas lus zhig nas ngan song dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, they become intoxicated, careless, and engage in misconduct, and when their body breaks up they are reborn in the lower realms.

original: gal te dga' ba dang / rtsed mo la sogs pa'i dngos po yin la /
analyzed: gal te dga' ba dang / rtsed mo la sogs pa'i dngos po yin la /
translated: If they are objects of enjoyment and play,

original: ngan song du 'gro bar byed pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro bar byed pa yang ma yin /
translated: and they do not cause one to go to the lower realms,

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin na ni de lta bu'i dga' ba dang / rtsed mo la sogs pa'i dngos po de sems dga' bar bya ba'i phyir slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin na ni de lta bu'i dga' ba dang / rtsed mo la sogs pa'i dngos po de sems dga' bar bya ba'i phyir slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed de /
translated: If it is not a root of nonvirtue, then he gives to petitioners that kind of thing, such as a pleasure or a game, in order to gladden their minds.

original: dngos po des kyang sdud pa dang yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po des kyang sdud pa dang yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And he attracts and develops them by means of that thing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba rnams la dga' ba dang / rtsed mo'i dngos po ji lta bu ni sbyin par mi byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba rnams la dga' ba dang / rtsed mo'i dngos po ji lta bu ni sbyin par mi byed /
translated: What kind of things for pleasure and games does the bodhisattva not give to petitioners?

original: ji lta bu ni sbyin par byed ce na /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji lta bu ni sbyin par byed ce na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What kind does he give?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni ri dags gsang pa'i thabs bslab pa sbyin par mi byed do //üîΩmchod sbyin ngan pa yo lang chen po gang du srog chags mang po bsogs nas gsod par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mchod @177b sbyin dag bdag nyid kyang mi byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni ri dags gsang pa'i thabs bslab pa sbyin par mi byed do // mchod sbyin ngan pa yo lang chen po gang du srog chags mang po bsogs nas gsod par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mchod @177b sbyin dag bdag nyid kyang mi byed la /
translated: He does not give, for example, the training in the secret arts of sexual intercourse.

original: gzhan dag kyang mchod sbyin byed du mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang mchod sbyin byed du mi 'jug go //
translated: He does not perform or cause others to perform such sacrifices as the great sacrifice of the five types of meat, in which many living beings are slaughtered.

original: lha rten rnams su phyugs gsod pa sbyin par mi byed do //üîΩsrog chags mang po gnas pa'i sa phyogs srog chags chu nas skyes pa'am /
analyzed: lha rten rnams su phyugs gsod pa sbyin par mi byed do // srog chags mang po gnas pa'i sa phyogs srog chags chu nas skyes pa'am /
translated: They do not give animals to be slaughtered in temples.üîΩThey do not give living beings to those who want to harm living beings,

original: thang las skyes pa rnams gnas pa lta bu /üîΩsrog chags de dag la gnod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thang las skyes pa rnams gnas pa lta bu / srog chags de dag la gnod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: such as those who seek to harm living beings born in water or on land.

original: slong na sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: slong na sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: They do not give living beings to those who seek to harm them.

original: rgya dang rngon gyi 'khrul 'khor dang / rgya dang rngon gyi 'khrul 'khor bslab pa yang srog chags rnams la gnod par bya ba'i phyir slong na sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: rgya dang rngon gyi 'khrul 'khor dang / rgya dang rngon gyi 'khrul 'khor bslab pa yang srog chags rnams la gnod par bya ba'i phyir slong na sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: They do not give nets, snares, and traps to those who seek to harm living beings.

original: spyo ba dang / gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / chad pas gcad pa dang / gnod pa byed du gzhug pa'i phyir yang dgra rnams kyi dgra sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: spyo ba dang / gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / chad pas gcad pa dang / gnod pa byed du gzhug pa'i phyir yang dgra rnams kyi dgra sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: They do not give enemies to enemies for the purpose of insulting, killing, binding, punishing, or harming them.

original: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi dga' ba dang rtsed mo'i dngos po sems can pha rol la gnod par 'gyur pa dang / sems can pha rol la sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi dga' ba dang rtsed mo'i dngos po sems can pha rol la gnod par 'gyur pa dang / sems can pha rol la sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva does not give to petitioners any object of joy or play that would harm another being or cause suffering to another being.

original: glang po che dang rta dang shing rta dang 'degs pa dang / bzhon pa rnams dang / gos dang / rgyan rnams dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bsod pa rnams dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra bslab pa rnams dang /
analyzed: glang po che dang rta dang shing rta dang 'degs pa dang / bzhon pa rnams dang / gos dang / rgyan rnams dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bsod pa rnams dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra bslab pa rnams dang /
translated: He does not give elephants, horses, chariots, vehicles, conveyances, clothes, ornaments, food, drink, delicacies, training in dance, song, and music,

original: gar dang / glu dang rol mo'i sgra'i cha byad rnams dang / spos dang me tog phreng ba dang / byug pa sna tshogs dang / snod spyad sna tshogs dang / skyed mos tshal dang / khang khyim dang dga' mgur spyad pa'i bud med rnams dang /
analyzed: gar dang / glu dang rol mo'i sgra'i cha byad rnams dang / spos dang me tog phreng ba dang / byug pa sna tshogs dang / snod spyad sna tshogs dang / skyed mos tshal dang / khang khyim dang dga' mgur spyad pa'i bud med rnams dang /
translated: or the implements of dance, song, and music, or various perfumes, garlands, and ointments, or various household goods, or parks, houses, and women for sexual enjoyment.

original: bzo dang las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs bslab pa gang yin pa de dag dang / de lta bu'i dga' ba dang / rtsed mo'i dngos po gang yin pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dga' bar bya ba'i phyir slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed do //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' ni nad pa slong du zin kyang /
analyzed: bzo dang las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs bslab pa gang yin pa de dag dang / de lta bu'i dga' ba dang / rtsed mo'i dngos po gang yin pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dga' bar bya ba'i phyir slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed do // byang chub sems dpa' ni nad pa slong du zin kyang /
translated: Whatever the various kinds of crafts and occupations that are to be learned, and whatever the various kinds of amusements and enjoyments, the bodhisattva gives these to petitioners in order to gladden their minds.

original: kha zas dang btung ba tshod ma zin pa'am /
analyzed: kha zas dang btung ba tshod ma zin pa'am /
translated: Even if a bodhisattva is asked by a sick person for food or drink that is unsuitable or harmful,

original: gnod par 'gyur ba sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: gnod par 'gyur ba sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: he or she does not give it.

original: sems can brkam pa'i rang bzhin can 'grangs pa rnams la bza' ba dang / btung ba bsod pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: sems can brkam pa'i rang bzhin can 'grangs pa rnams la bza' ba dang / btung ba bsod pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: Nor does a bodhisattva give fine food and drink to those who are greedy and who have overindulged.

original: sems can mya ngan gyis gdungs pa rnams rang 'geg par byed pa'am /
analyzed: sems can mya ngan gyis gdungs pa rnams rang 'geg par byed pa'am /
translated: Nor does a bodhisattva allow those who are tormented by grief to drown themselves,

original: rdeg par byed pa'am /
analyzed: rdeg par byed pa'am /
translated: to beat themselves,

original: dug 'thung ba'am /üîΩg-yang @178a * //
analyzed: dug 'thung ba'am / g-yang @178a * //
translated: to ingest poison,

original: du mchong pa la yang dga' mgur byed du mi 'jug go //
analyzed: du mchong pa la yang dga' mgur byed du mi 'jug go //
translated: or to throw themselves off a cliff.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba rnams la pha ma thams cad kyis thams cad du sbyin par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba rnams la pha ma thams cad kyis thams cad du sbyin par yang mi byed de /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not give everything to beggars, everything to their parents.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i pha ma ni bla ma lta bu'i mchog yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i pha ma ni bla ma lta bu'i mchog yin te /
translated: Because the parents of bodhisattvas are the supreme gurus.

original: nu ma snun pa dang / gso ba dang skyed pa yin pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas yun ring por spyi bo la khyer na yang skyo bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: nu ma snun pa dang / gso ba dang skyed pa yin pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas yun ring por spyi bo la khyer na yang skyo bar mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, even though they have carried them on their heads for a long time, bodhisattvas do not get tired of their parents.

original: spu gta' dang gtar gzhug pa dang / gtso bo'i tshul gyis bdag nyid kyang de gnyis la sbyin zhing dbang ba dang / rag lus par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: spu gta' dang gtar gzhug pa dang / gtso bo'i tshul gyis bdag nyid kyang de gnyis la sbyin zhing dbang ba dang / rag lus par bya ba yin na /
translated: If they give themselves to their parents as their property and as their slaves, as if they were collateral or a deposit,

original: byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la ji ltar sbyin par sems te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gzhan dag la ji ltar sbyin par sems te /
translated: how could bodhisattvas think of giving other things to others?

original: sbyin pa lta ga la byed /
analyzed: sbyin pa lta ga la byed /
translated: How could they not give?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rgyal po spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba po'i bdag por gyur na yang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rgyal po spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba po'i bdag por gyur na yang /
translated: Even if bodhisattvas become kings anointed on the head,

original: bdag gi ris su gtogs pa'i sems can yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi gzhan gyi bu dang chung ma gzhan dag las phrogs te gzhan dag la sbyin par mi byed kyi nga la ji ltar gyur pa ltar de dag la yang de bzhin du gyur
analyzed: bdag gi ris su gtogs pa'i sems can yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi gzhan gyi bu dang chung ma gzhan dag las phrogs te gzhan dag la sbyin par mi byed kyi nga la ji ltar gyur pa ltar de dag la yang de bzhin du gyur
translated: He does not take away the sons and wives of others who belong to his own class and give them to others. He thinks, ‚ÄúMay they be just as they are.

original: cig snyam nas grong ril po 'am /
analyzed: cig snyam nas grong ril po 'am /
translated: ‚Äù He gives a whole village,

original: grong gi phyogs 'ga' 'am /
analyzed: grong gi phyogs 'ga' 'am /
translated: a part of a village,

original: phyogs ril po 'am /
analyzed: phyogs ril po 'am /
translated: a whole region,

original: ljongs kyi phyogs 'ga' longs spyod du bya bar sbyin pa sbyin par zad do //
analyzed: ljongs kyi phyogs 'ga' longs spyod du bya bar sbyin pa sbyin par zad do //
translated: or a part of a region to be used as he wishes.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi bu dang chung ma dang / bran dang bran mo dang las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / yongs su zin pa rnams legs par brda ma sprad pa dang / mi 'dod bzhin pa dang / yid mi dga' bzhin du gzhan 'dod pa rnams la sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi bu dang chung ma dang / bran dang bran mo dang las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / yongs su zin pa rnams legs par brda ma sprad pa dang / mi 'dod bzhin pa dang / yid mi dga' bzhin du gzhan 'dod pa rnams la sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: A bodhisattva does not give away his own sons, wives, slaves, servants, workers, or even those who are under his protection without their consent, unwillingly, or against their will, even if requested.

original: legs par brda sprad de yid dga' zhing 'dun par gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: legs par brda sprad de yid dga' zhing 'dun par gyur du zin kyang /
translated: Even if he has been properly informed and has become happy and eager,

original: mi mdza' ba rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / srin po rnams dang / brjed ngas pa rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi mdza' ba rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / srin po rnams dang / brjed ngas pa rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: he does not give to those who are not dear to him, to yakshas, to rakshasas, or to the forgetful.

original: bu dang chung ma dang skyid de bar 'dug pa'i rigs kyi bu mi'i bran du sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: bu dang chung ma dang skyid de bar 'dug pa'i rigs kyi bu mi'i bran du sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: He does not give his son, wife, or his own flesh to those who ask for them, if they are of a family that is not suitable, or if they are human slaves.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po shas cher gzhan la gnod pa byed par zhugs shing brjed ngas pa rnams la rgyal srid sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po shas cher gzhan la gnod pa byed par zhugs shing brjed ngas pa rnams la rgyal srid sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give his kingdom to beggars who are mostly engaged in harming others and are forgetful.

original: gal te dbyung ba'i mthu yod na de 'dra ba'i gang zag ni rgyal srid las kyang 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: gal te dbyung ba'i mthu yod na de 'dra ba'i gang zag ni rgyal srid las kyang 'byin par byed do //
translated: If he has the power to rescue them, he rescues such persons even from their kingdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni pha ma'i longs spyod phrogs @178b te slong ba rnams la sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni pha ma'i longs spyod phrogs @178b te slong ba rnams la sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not take the wealth of his parents and give it to beggars.

original: pha ma ji lta ba bzhin du bu dang / chung ma dang / bran dang bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: pha ma ji lta ba bzhin du bu dang / chung ma dang / bran dang bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as with parents, so it is with children, spouse, male and female servants, workers, and hired persons.

original: pha ma la gnod pa byas nas rgyas par las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba'i bar dag la gnod pa byas nas pha rol slong ba rnams la sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong bar yang mi byed do //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyis bab chol ma yin par longs spyod rnams bsgrubs nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed kyi /
analyzed: pha ma la gnod pa byas nas rgyas par las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba'i bar dag la gnod pa byas nas pha rol slong ba rnams la sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong bar yang mi byed do // byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyis bab chol ma yin par longs spyod rnams bsgrubs nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed kyi /
translated: He does not give gifts to beggars by harming his parents, and so on up to: by harming his hired persons.

original: chos ma yin bas ma yin /üîΩbab chol du ma yin /
analyzed: chos ma yin bas ma yin / bab chol du ma yin /
translated: The bodhisattva gives gifts of possessions that have been acquired lawfully, not unlawfully.

original: pha rol la gnod par byas shing nyam nga bar byas pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol la gnod par byas shing nyam nga bar byas pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: He does not give gifts that are harmful to others, nor does he give thoughtlessly.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bstan pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ji lta bur yang bslab pa las 'gal bar byas te sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bstan pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ji lta bur yang bslab pa las 'gal bar byas te sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the teaching of the Lord Buddhas does not give gifts in any way that violates the training.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa sbyin pa na yang mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang / tha mal pa rnams dang / yon tan can rnams dang / skyon can rnams dang / dman pa rnams dang / mtshungs pa rnams dang / khyad du 'phags pa rnams dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa sbyin pa na yang mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang / tha mal pa rnams dang / yon tan can rnams dang / skyon can rnams dang / dman pa rnams dang / mtshungs pa rnams dang / khyad du 'phags pa rnams dang /
translated: When the bodhisattva gives gifts, he does so with a mind that is a field of merit for friends, enemies, and strangers; for those with good qualities and those with faults; for the lowly, the equal, and the superior;

original: skyid pa rnams dang / sdug pa rnams la yon gnas yin pa'i sems nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: skyid pa rnams dang / sdug pa rnams la yon gnas yin pa'i sems nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: for the happy and the miserable.

original: sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives gifts with a mind that is impartial toward all beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni ji skad smras pa dang / ji ltar dam bcas pa las bskyungs te slong ba la sbyin par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni ji skad smras pa dang / ji ltar dam bcas pa las bskyungs te slong ba la sbyin par mi byed kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva does not give gifts to beggars in a way that is contrary to his word and his promises.

original: mtshungs pa'am lhag pa kho nar byed do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'am lhag pa kho nar byed do //
translated: He gives only what is equal or superior.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dngos po bzang po sbyin par dam bcas na ngan pa dang / tha chad sbyin par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dngos po bzang po sbyin par dam bcas na ngan pa dang / tha chad sbyin par mi byed kyi /
translated: When a bodhisattva has promised to give a good object, he does not give a bad or inferior one.

original: ngan pa dang tha chad sbyin par dam bcas su zin kyang /
analyzed: ngan pa dang tha chad sbyin par dam bcas su zin kyang /
translated: Even if he has promised to give a bad or inferior one,

original: bzang po yod na bzang po 'ba' zhig sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: bzang po yod na bzang po 'ba' zhig sbyin par byed do //
translated: if he has a good one, he gives only the good one.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni yid mi dga' ba dang / khros pa dang / yid 'khrugs pas sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni yid mi dga' ba dang / khros pa dang / yid 'khrugs pas sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: A bodhisattva does not give a gift while unhappy, angry, or disturbed.

original: sbyin pa byin nas kyang yang dang yang du brjod cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin nas kyang yang dang yang du brjod cing /
translated: Even after giving a gift, he does not repeatedly mention

original: khyod ni 'di dang 'di lta bur ngas sbyin pas phan gdags so zhe 'am /
analyzed: khyod ni 'di dang 'di lta bur ngas sbyin pas phan gdags so zhe 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúI helped you in this way by giving you this or that gift.

original: bskyed do zhe 'am /
analyzed: bskyed do zhe 'am /
translated: I developed you.

original: drangs so zhes smos par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: drangs so zhes smos par yang mi byed do //
translated: I brought you here.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni mi ngan pa la sbyin pa sbyin na yang brnyas shing ma gus par sbyin par yang mi byed @179a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni mi ngan pa la sbyin pa sbyin na yang brnyas shing ma gus par sbyin par yang mi byed @179a * //
translated: Even when giving a gift to a bad person, a bodhisattva does not give it contemptuously or disrespectfully.

original: na ; yon tan can la lta ci smos /
analyzed: na ; yon tan can la lta ci smos /
translated: what need be said about those who have good qualities?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po log par bsgrub pa rnam pa sna tshogs la gnas pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po log par bsgrub pa rnam pa sna tshogs la gnas pa /
translated: The bodhisattva does not give a gift with a mind that is discouraged by the various kinds of ingratitude of petitioners,

original: rgod pa bdag nyid ma bsdams pa /
analyzed: rgod pa bdag nyid ma bsdams pa /
translated: who are frivolous, unrestrained,

original: gshe ba khro ba /üîΩspyo 'debs pa rnams kyi log par bsgrubs pas skyo ba'i yid kyis sbyin pa mi sbyin par yang mi byed kyi /
analyzed: gshe ba khro ba / spyo 'debs pa rnams kyi log par bsgrubs pas skyo ba'i yid kyis sbyin pa mi sbyin par yang mi byed kyi /
translated: abusive, angry, and insulting.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag nyid las shas cher nyon mongs pas brlabs pa'i rang bzhin can yin par rtogs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag nyid las shas cher nyon mongs pas brlabs pa'i rang bzhin can yin par rtogs nas /
translated: But the bodhisattva, realizing that they are overwhelmed by the force of their afflictions,

original: snying brtse ba'i sems kho na nye bar gzhag ste sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i sems kho na nye bar gzhag ste sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: gives a gift to them with a mind that is full of loving-kindness.

original: lta ba ngan pa mchog tu 'dzin cing sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa mchog tu 'dzin cing sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed de /
translated: He or she does not give a gift while holding a wrong view,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: such as

original: gnod pa chen po'i mchod sbyin rnams dang / 'tshe ba'i sbyin pas chos su 'gyur bar mi 'dzin pa dang / dge mtshan dang bkra shis dang sbyar te sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: gnod pa chen po'i mchod sbyin rnams dang / 'tshe ba'i sbyin pas chos su 'gyur bar mi 'dzin pa dang / dge mtshan dang bkra shis dang sbyar te sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: He does not give gifts in connection with good omens, for the sake of good fortune.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi sbyin pa tsam shin tu rnam par dag pas kyang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par dag par 'gyur bar yang mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi sbyin pa tsam shin tu rnam par dag pas kyang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par dag par 'gyur bar yang mi 'dzin te /
translated: He does not consider that the mere giving of gifts in all ways, even if it is very pure, is the purification of the world and the transcendence of the world.

original: sbyin pa ni rnam par dag par 'gyur pa'i tshogs tsam 'ba' zhig yin par 'dzin to //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni rnam par dag par 'gyur pa'i tshogs tsam 'ba' zhig yin par 'dzin to //
translated: He considers that it is only the accumulation of the purification of giving.

original: 'bras bu la lta zhing sbyin par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bu la lta zhing sbyin par mi byed de /
translated: He does not give gifts while looking for results.

original: sbyin pa thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed do //
translated: He dedicates all his giving to supreme and complete awakening.

original: sbyin pa rnam pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu rnam pa thams cad rnam par smin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong zhing mngon par yid ches pa skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu rnam pa thams cad rnam par smin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong zhing mngon par yid ches pa skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing /
translated: The bodhisattva who sees and has clear faith in the results of all kinds of generosity, in all their aspects, gives gifts without being led by others.

original: gzhan gyis bkri ba med par sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bkri ba med par sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: He gives gifts without being led by others.üîΩFor example, it is said in the scriptures:

original: dper na / zas byin pas ni stobs can 'gyur //üîΩgos byin pas ni kha dog ldan //
analyzed: dper na / zas byin pas ni stobs can 'gyur // gos byin pas ni kha dog ldan //
translated: ‚ÄúBy giving food, one becomes strong.üîΩBy giving clothing, one becomes beautiful.

original: bzhon pa byin pas bde 'gyur brtan //
analyzed: bzhon pa byin pas bde 'gyur brtan //
translated: By giving vehicles, one becomes steady.

original: mar me byin pas mig dang ldan //
analyzed: mar me byin pas mig dang ldan //
translated: By giving lamps, one obtains eyesight.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: And so on at length.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dbul por 'gyur du dogs pa'i 'jigs pas sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dbul por 'gyur du dogs pa'i 'jigs pas sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give gifts out of fear of becoming poor.

original: snying rje'i bsam pa kho na 'ba' zhig gis sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: snying rje'i bsam pa kho na 'ba' zhig gis sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives gifts out of a compassionate attitude alone.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba rnams dang mi mthun pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed de /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba rnams dang mi mthun pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed de / 'di lta ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not give gifts that are incompatible with the requests of those who are asking.

original: sdom pa la brtson pa rnams la zas dang skom lhag mar gyur pa'am byis dang / gcin dang mchi lam @179b dang snabs dang skyugs pa dang rnyang bu dang rnag dang / khrag gis 'bags pa'am /
analyzed: sdom pa la brtson pa rnams la zas dang skom lhag mar gyur pa'am byis dang / gcin dang mchi lam @179b dang snabs dang skyugs pa dang rnyang bu dang rnag dang / khrag gis 'bags pa'am /
translated: They do not give food and drink that has been left over, or food and drink that is contaminated with urine, feces, snot, vomit, pus, or blood, to those who are striving in the practice of vows.

original: zhag lon pa'i khongs su ma bsnyad ma sbran 'bras chan dang nas chan dor bar 'os pa'am /
analyzed: zhag lon pa'i khongs su ma bsnyad ma sbran 'bras chan dang nas chan dor bar 'os pa'am /
translated: They do not give rice or barley gruel that is not fit to be eaten, that has not been announced and prepared the previous day, to those who are observing a one-day vow.

original: de bzhin du sgog btsong mi za ba dag la sgog btsong gis 'bags pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgog btsong mi za ba dag la sgog btsong gis 'bags pa'am /
translated: They do not give food that is contaminated with garlic to those who are abstaining from eating garlic.

original: de bzhin du sha mi za ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sha mi za ba'am /
translated: They do not give meat to those who are abstaining from eating meat.

original: chang mi 'thung bdag la chang dang 'dres shing chang dang 'bags pa dang / de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i las byed du 'jug cing /
analyzed: chang mi 'thung bdag la chang dang 'dres shing chang dang 'bags pa dang / de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i las byed du 'jug cing /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed de /

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po yang dang yang bslang dgos pa dang / slong zhing phyir 'ong du gzhug pa dang / rnyed pa 'tshol ba'i tshul gyis nyon mongs shing sbyin pa sbyin par yang mi byed de /

analyzed: bslangs ma thag kho nar sbyin par byed do //
