original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de'i mkhan po dang slob dpon dang / lhan cig gnas pa'i slob ma dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gang dag chags pa'i rang bzhin can dang / brkam pa'i rang bzhin can yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de'i mkhan po dang slob dpon dang / lhan cig gnas pa'i slob ma dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gang dag chags pa'i rang bzhin can dang / brkam pa'i rang bzhin can yin nam /
translated: Moreover, if the teacher, preceptor, fellow students, and fellow practitioners of the bodhisattva are of a greedy nature,

original: gang dag brkam pa'i rang @181b bzhin can ma yin yang sbyin par bya ba'i chos med de /
analyzed: gang dag brkam pa'i rang @181b bzhin can ma yin yang sbyin par bya ba'i chos med de /
translated: or if they are not greedy but lack the things to be given,üîΩthen the bodhisattva, wishing to perform a meritorious deed consisting of giving,

original: 'dod pas phongs par 'gyur na de la byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas la brten pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod pas phongs par 'gyur na de la byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas la brten pa'am /
translated: on the basis of the Buddha,

original: chos dang dge 'dun la brten te /üîΩsbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po byed par 'dod pas /
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun la brten te / sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po byed par 'dod pas /
translated: the Dharma, and the religious community,

original: sbyin par bya ba'i chos de rnams de dag nyid la sbyin zhing /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i chos de rnams de dag nyid la sbyin zhing /
translated: gives those things to be given to them,

original: de dag byed du 'jug ste bdag nyid mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag byed du 'jug ste bdag nyid mi byed do //
translated: and makes them do it, but does not do it himself.

original: de ltar byas pas byang chub sems dpa' des bdag nyid kyis kyang bsod nams shin tu mang du skyed pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar byas pas byang chub sems dpa' des bdag nyid kyis kyang bsod nams shin tu mang du skyed pa yin /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva himself generates a great deal of merit.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa de gcig gi nyon mongs pa yang btul ba yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa de gcig gi nyon mongs pa yang btul ba yin te /
translated: He also subdues the afflictions of that one spiritual practitioner.

original: de kha cig ni chos 'dod pa yang yongs su rdzogs par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de kha cig ni chos 'dod pa yang yongs su rdzogs par byas pa yin te /
translated: He also fulfills the wishes of some who desire the Dharma.

original: sems can bsdus pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can bsdus pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He also attracts sentient beings and ripens sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos ngag yod de bdog na /üîΩslong ba po'i bsam pa mtshan ma tsam gyis rtogs na yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos ngag yod de bdog na / slong ba po'i bsam pa mtshan ma tsam gyis rtogs na yang /
translated: Moreover, when the bodhisattva has the Dharma that is to be given,

original: ci 'dod pa sbyin par bya ba'i chos rnams sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: ci 'dod pa sbyin par bya ba'i chos rnams sbyin par byed do //
translated: he gives whatever is desired, even if he understands the thought of the petitioner from mere signs.

original: gang zhig 'di sgyu tshong gis brid par bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di sgyu tshong gis brid par bya'o snyam ste /
translated: When someone comes to him thinking, ‚ÄúI will deceive him with trickery,‚Äù

original: de'i thad du 'ongs na yang de'i bsam pa rtogs nas /
analyzed: de'i thad du 'ongs na yang de'i bsam pa rtogs nas /
translated: he understands his thought,

original: de'i nyes par spyod pa gzhan dag la yang 'chab par byed na /
analyzed: de'i nyes par spyod pa gzhan dag la yang 'chab par byed na /
translated: and he conceals his misdeeds from others.

original: de nyid la lta ci smos te /
analyzed: de nyid la lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention the case where the bodhisattva is the one who is asked?

original: de'i 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
translated: He fulfills the desires of those who ask,

original: ci nas kyang de skyengs par mi 'gyur ba dang / mgu zhing 'jigs pa med pa dang / yid dga' bar gyur pas phyir 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang de skyengs par mi 'gyur ba dang / mgu zhing 'jigs pa med pa dang / yid dga' bar gyur pas phyir 'gro bar byed do //
translated: and he sends them away satisfied, fearless, and delighted, in such a way that they will not be embarrassed.

original: gang gis byang chub sems dpa' g-yo sgyus brid par gyur la /
analyzed: gang gis byang chub sems dpa' g-yo sgyus brid par gyur la /
translated: Even if a bodhisattva is deceived by trickery,

original: brid pa de yang des sngar ma rtogs te phyis rtogs par gyur na yang /
analyzed: brid pa de yang des sngar ma rtogs te phyis rtogs par gyur na yang /
translated: and even if he does not realize that he has been deceived,

original: 'brid pa'i gang zag de la gzhi des gleng pa'am dran par mi byed la de'i sgyu thabs kyis ma byin par len pa de dag thams cad la yang bsam pas rjes su dga' bar byed de /
analyzed: 'brid pa'i gang zag de la gzhi des gleng pa'am dran par mi byed la de'i sgyu thabs kyis ma byin par len pa de dag thams cad la yang bsam pas rjes su dga' bar byed de /
translated: he does not later accuse the person who deceived him, nor does he remember it. He approves of all the deceptions of those who have taken the vow of the bodhisattva.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin par bya ba'i chos yod de bdog pa rnams shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin par bya ba'i chos yod de bdog pa rnams shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These and other similar things should be known as the generosity of a wise bodhisattva with regard to the things that he or she should give and the things that he or she possesses.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos dag med de mi bdog na'ang /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos dag med de mi bdog na'ang /
translated: Moreover, even if a bodhisattva does not have the things to be given,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bzo dang las kyi gnas de dang de dag la sbyangs pa de bzo dang las kyi gnas de lta bu mngon du byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bzo dang las kyi gnas de dang de dag la sbyangs pa de bzo dang las kyi gnas de lta bu mngon du byed cing /
translated: he or she has trained in the various crafts and occupations and manifests those crafts and occupations.

original: des tshigs chung ngus nor gyi phung po chen po bsgrubs te gnas so //üîΩyang na byang chub sems dpa' gtam sna tshogs dang / @182a * //
analyzed: des tshigs chung ngus nor gyi phung po chen po bsgrubs te gnas so // yang na byang chub sems dpa' gtam sna tshogs dang / @182a * //
translated: With little difficulty, he or she acquires a great amount of wealth and lives.

original: snyan pa'i gtam dang / spobs pa dge ba dang ldan pa ci nas sems can dbul po rnams kyang sbyin par byed 'dod par gyur na /
analyzed: snyan pa'i gtam dang / spobs pa dge ba dang ldan pa ci nas sems can dbul po rnams kyang sbyin par byed 'dod par gyur na /
translated: Or else, a bodhisattva teaches the Dharma to others in such a way that even poor people will want to practice generosity,üîΩlet alone the wealthy.

original: phyug po rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa dang / ser sna can rnams kyang sbyin par byed 'dod par gyur na /üîΩgtong ba'i rang bzhin can rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa de ltar gzhan dag la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: phyug po rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa dang / ser sna can rnams kyang sbyin par byed 'dod par gyur na /üîΩgtong ba'i rang bzhin can rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa de ltar gzhan dag la chos ston par byed do //
translated: Even stingy people will want to practice generosity,üîΩlet alone those who are naturally generous.

original: yang na slong ba po lhags shing lhags pa rnams dad pa dang ldan pa'i khyim gang dag na longs spyod rgya chen po dang ldan pas /
analyzed: yang na slong ba po lhags shing lhags pa rnams dad pa dang ldan pa'i khyim gang dag na longs spyod rgya chen po dang ldan pas /
translated: Or else, when beggars come again and again, he sends them to the homes of faithful householders who have great wealth

original: nyin gcig bzhin du sbyin par bya ba'i chos kho na la 'jug pa'i khyim de dag tu gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: nyin gcig bzhin du sbyin par bya ba'i chos kho na la 'jug pa'i khyim de dag tu gtong bar byed do //
translated: and who are engaged in the practice of generosity day after day.

original: bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa sbyin zhing bsod nams byed pa dag tu song nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa sbyin zhing bsod nams byed pa dag tu song nas /
translated: He himself goes to the places where generosity is practiced and merit is made.üîΩHaving gone there, he delights his mind with his skill, diligence, and perseverance.

original: mkhas pa dang le lo med pa dang sgrub phod pas sems mngon par dga' bar byas nas lus dang ngag gis ci nus ci lcogs kyis nyams su len par byed la /
analyzed: mkhas pa dang le lo med pa dang sgrub phod pas sems mngon par dga' bar byas nas lus dang ngag gis ci nus ci lcogs kyis nyams su len par byed la /
translated: He practices with his body and speech as much as he is able and as much as he can.

original: sbyin pa de yang slong ba rnams la legs par sbyin par byed do //üîΩde ltar na ngo ma snyoms pa'am /üîΩtshul ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa de yang slong ba rnams la legs par sbyin par byed do // de ltar na ngo ma snyoms pa'am / tshul ma yin pa'am /
translated: He gives that gift well to the beggars.üîΩIn this way, he does not give a gift that is wrongly given,üîΩbecause it is not given in an unequal manner,

original: brjed ngas pas zhal te byed pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir sbyin pa de nyes bar byin pa gang yin pa de med par 'gyur /
analyzed: brjed ngas pas zhal te byed pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir sbyin pa de nyes bar byin pa gang yin pa de med par 'gyur /
translated: or in an improper manner, or through forgetfulness, or in a manner that is contrary to what one has promised.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni ji srid du bsam pa rnam par dag pa ma thob kyi bar du longs spyod dag med de /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni ji srid du bsam pa rnam par dag pa ma thob kyi bar du longs spyod dag med de /
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas do not have enjoyments until they attain the completely pure intention.

original: mi bdog bzhin du shes rab can gyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mi bdog bzhin du shes rab can gyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, as long as he has not attained the purity of intention, gives gifts with wisdom, even though he has no possessions and no wealth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa ni ji lta bus ngan song las yang dag par 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba de lta bur tshe rabs thams cad du longs spyod zad mi shes pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa ni ji lta bus ngan song las yang dag par 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba de lta bur tshe rabs thams cad du longs spyod zad mi shes pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva, with his superior intention pure, obtains inexhaustible wealth in all his lives, in such a way that he attains the transcendence of the miserable states.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni mu stegs can glags tshol ba la chos khas 'chad pa'am /üîΩglegs bam du byas pa'am sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni mu stegs can glags tshol ba la chos khas 'chad pa'am / glegs bam du byas pa'am sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva does not give the Dharma to tirthikas who seek a chance to criticize it, nor does he give it in written form.

original: chags pa'i rang bzhin can glegs bam 'tshong bar 'dod pa'am sbed par 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: chags pa'i rang bzhin can glegs bam 'tshong bar 'dod pa'am sbed par 'dod pa'am /
translated: He does not give it to those who would sell it, or to those who would hoard it, if they desire it out of attachment to it.

original: de shes pas don du gnyer ba ma yin pa la yang sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: de shes pas don du gnyer ba ma yin pa la yang sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: He does not give it to those who do not seek it out of a desire to understand it.

original: shes par 'dod pa la ni gal te glegs bam bdag la dgos pa'i don byas zin na de la ci bder sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa la ni gal te glegs bam bdag la dgos pa'i don byas zin na de la ci bder sbyin par byed do //
translated: If the book has already served its purpose for him, he should give it away as he wishes.

original: gal te des gang gi don du glegs bam de bsgrubs pa'i don ma grub na ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' des dpe gzhan ma mthong na sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: gal te des gang gi don du glegs bam de bsgrubs pa'i don ma grub na ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' des dpe gzhan ma mthong na sbyin par byed do //
translated: But if the purpose for which he acquired the book has not been achieved, then the bodhisattva should give the book if he has seen another copy,

original: yang na gzhan bris te sbyin par byed @182b do ;üîΩ/ gal te dpe gzhan yang ma mthong ngam /
analyzed: yang na gzhan bris te sbyin par byed @182b do ; / gal te dpe gzhan yang ma mthong ngam /
translated: or if he has not seen another copy, then he should give it after he has copied it.

original: 'dri yang mi nus na ni des thog ma kho nar bdag gi sems la brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dri yang mi nus na ni des thog ma kho nar bdag gi sems la brtag par bya ste /
translated: But if he has not seen another copy and is not able to copy it, then he should first examine his own mind,

original: bdag gi sems chos la ser sna byed pa'i dri mas kun nas dkris par ma gyur grang /
analyzed: bdag gi sems chos la ser sna byed pa'i dri mas kun nas dkris par ma gyur grang /
translated: thinking, ‚ÄúIs my mind entangled in the defilement of stinginess with regard to the Dharma?

original: bdag chos bris pa snying nas sbyin par mi 'dod pa kho na ma yin grang snyam du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag chos bris pa snying nas sbyin par mi 'dod pa kho na ma yin grang snyam du brtag par bya'o //
translated: Am I not simply unwilling to give the Dharma because I love it?‚Äù

original: gal te des de ltar brtags pa na bdag la chos la ser sna byed pa'i dri ma cung zad kun du spyod pa yang yod do snyam du shes na ni /
analyzed: gal te des de ltar brtags pa na bdag la chos la ser sna byed pa'i dri ma cung zad kun du spyod pa yang yod do snyam du shes na ni /
translated: If, when he examines himself in this way, he knows that he does have the slightest bit of the stain of stinginess with regard to the Dharma,

original: byang chub sems dpa' des 'di snyam du gal te bdag chos kyi sbyin pa 'dis tshe 'di la lkugs pa kho nar gyur na yang bdag gis nyon mongs pa dang du blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des 'di snyam du gal te bdag chos kyi sbyin pa 'dis tshe 'di la lkugs pa kho nar gyur na yang bdag gis nyon mongs pa dang du blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: then that bodhisattva should think, ‚ÄúEven if, because of this gift of Dharma, I were to become mute in this life, I would not accept that affliction.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa nges par sbyin dgos par 'gyur na ye shes kyi tshogs med par 'gyur ba lta ci smos snyam du sems mngon par 'du byas te /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa nges par sbyin dgos par 'gyur na ye shes kyi tshogs med par 'gyur ba lta ci smos snyam du sems mngon par 'du byas te /
translated: If I must definitely give the gift of Dharma, what need is there to mention the accumulation of wisdom?‚Äù

original: chos kyi sbyin pa de nges pa kho nar sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa de nges pa kho nar sbyin par bya'o //
translated: With this thought, he should definitely give that gift of Dharma.

original: gal te de ltar rtog pa na bdag la ni chos la ser sna byed pa'i dri ma cung zad kun du spyod pa yang med do snyam du shes na ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rtog pa na bdag la ni chos la ser sna byed pa'i dri ma cung zad kun du spyod pa yang med do snyam du shes na ni /
translated: If, when he examines himself in this way, he knows that he does not have the slightest bit of the stain of stinginess with regard to the Dharma,

original: byang chub sems dpa' des 'di ltar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des 'di ltar brtag par bya ste /
translated: then that bodhisattva should examine himself in this way:

original: bdag gis ni nyon mongs pa gzhom pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bdag gis ni nyon mongs pa gzhom pa'i phyir ram /
translated: I give this gift of Dharma in order to destroy afflictions,

original: ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: in order to complete the accumulation of wisdom,

original: sems can dga' bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sbyin pa 'di sbyin par byed pa yin na ngas nyon mongs pa yang ma mthong la /
analyzed: sems can dga' bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sbyin pa 'di sbyin par byed pa yin na ngas nyon mongs pa yang ma mthong la /
translated: and in order to delight sentient beings.

original: ma byin na tshe 'di dang phyi ma la ye shes kyi tshogs che bas mang du mthong la /
analyzed: ma byin na tshe 'di dang phyi ma la ye shes kyi tshogs che bas mang du mthong la /
translated: If I do not give it, I will see a great increase in the accumulation of wisdom in this and future lives.

original: byin na ni rtogs pa chen por mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: byin na ni rtogs pa chen por mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If I give it, I will not have great realization.

original: tshe phyi ma la chos kyi rnyed pa chen por 'gyur gyi chung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la chos kyi rnyed pa chen por 'gyur gyi chung ba ma yin la /
translated: If I do not give it, I will have great gain of Dharma in future lives, not a small one.

original: ma byin na ni ngas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir ye shes bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: ma byin na ni ngas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir ye shes bsgrubs pas /
translated: If I do not give it, I will accomplish wisdom for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to all sentient beings.

original: sems can 'di dang sems can gzhan thams cad dga' bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sems can 'di dang sems can gzhan thams cad dga' bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: I will delight this sentient being and all other sentient beings.

original: byin du zin na ni sems can 'di gcig pu dga' bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: byin du zin na ni sems can 'di gcig pu dga' bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: If I give it, I will delight only this one sentient being.‚Äù

original: de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes nas gal te byang chub sems dpa' ma byin na ni kha na ma tho bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes nas gal te byang chub sems dpa' ma byin na ni kha na ma tho bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: Thus, if a bodhisattva knows the truth just as it is and does not give, he will not be at fault.

original: 'gyod par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gyod par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: He will not have any regrets.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul las kyang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul las kyang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not be in conflict with the bodhisattva way of life.

original: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba la khyod la mi sbyin no zhes tshig brlang pos phyir zlog par mi byed mod kyi /üîΩ'on @183a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba la khyod la mi sbyin no zhes tshig brlang pos phyir zlog par mi byed mod kyi / 'on @183a * //
translated: A bodhisattva does not turn away a petitioner with harsh words, saying, ‚ÄúI will not give to you.‚Äù

original: kyang thabs mkhas pas de brda sprad de gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: kyang thabs mkhas pas de brda sprad de gtong bar byed do //
translated: But he does not give by using skillful means.

original: de la thabs mkhas pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la thabs mkhas pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the skillful means.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni yo byed thams cad dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos thams cad thog ma nas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bsam pa rnam par dag pas phul zhing bsngos zin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni yo byed thams cad dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos thams cad thog ma nas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bsam pa rnam par dag pas phul zhing bsngos zin te /
translated: A bodhisattva from the very beginning has offered and dedicated to the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions all his possessions and all the things that he will give.

original: dper na dge slong gis slob dpon nam mkhan po la chos gos bsngo ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dge slong gis slob dpon nam mkhan po la chos gos bsngo ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a monk dedicates his Dharma robes to his preceptor or teacher.

original: des de ltar bsngos pa'i phyir yo byad dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos sna tshogs rgya chen po thams cad bsags su zin kyang /
analyzed: des de ltar bsngos pa'i phyir yo byad dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos sna tshogs rgya chen po thams cad bsags su zin kyang /
translated: Because he has dedicated in this way, even though he has accumulated all the various extensive articles and Dharma to be given,

original: 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called a bodhisattva who abides in the family of the noble ones.

original: bsod nams dpag tu med pa yang 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dpag tu med pa yang 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He also increases his immeasurable merit.

original: de'i bsod nams de yang rtag tu de la lan mang du yid la byed pas dus thams cad du ldan par mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams de yang rtag tu de la lan mang du yid la byed pas dus thams cad du ldan par mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And that merit of his always increases manifestly, being connected with it at all times, because he frequently brings it to mind.

original: des sbyin par bya ba'i chos de dag kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gtams te gzhag pa dang 'dra bar 'chang bar byed de /
analyzed: des sbyin par bya ba'i chos de dag kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gtams te gzhag pa dang 'dra bar 'chang bar byed de /
translated: He also keeps those articles to be given as if they were placed there by the Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: gal te slong ba po mthong ba de la sbyin par bya ba'i chos ci 'dod pa sbyin par 'os pa zhig mthong na ni des sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams la yongs su ma btang ba gang yang med do snyam du shes
analyzed: gal te slong ba po mthong ba de la sbyin par bya ba'i chos ci 'dod pa sbyin par 'os pa zhig mthong na ni des sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams la yongs su ma btang ba gang yang med do snyam du shes
translated: If he sees someone who is worthy of being given something, who is a suitable recipient, then he should think, ‚ÄúThere is nothing that the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas have not given up to sentient beings.‚Äù

original: par byas nas slong ba po'i 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: par byas nas slong ba po'i 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: And having thought that, he should fulfill the wishes of the person who is asking.

original: gal te 'os pa ma yin par mthong na ni des rtog pa de nyid la brten nas bzhin bzangs dag 'di ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'os pa ma yin par mthong na ni des rtog pa de nyid la brten nas bzhin bzangs dag 'di ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: But if he sees that it is not suitable, then he should say to the person who is asking, using gentle words, ‚ÄúGood person, this belongs to someone else.

original: khed la sbyin par gnang ba med do zhes de la tshig 'jam pos go bar byed do //
analyzed: khed la sbyin par gnang ba med do zhes de la tshig 'jam pos go bar byed do //
translated: I am not allowed to give it to you.‚Äù

original: yang na gzhan de'i nyis 'gyur ram sum 'gyur sbyin zhing rim gro dang bkur stir byas nas gtong bar byed de /
analyzed: yang na gzhan de'i nyis 'gyur ram sum 'gyur sbyin zhing rim gro dang bkur stir byas nas gtong bar byed de /
translated: Or he should give twice or three times as much as was asked for, and then give it after honoring and respecting the person who is asking.

original: ci nas de byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni chags pa'i rang bzhin can du gyur te /
analyzed: ci nas de byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni chags pa'i rang bzhin can du gyur te /
translated: In this way, the person who is asking will not think, ‚ÄúThis Bodhisattva is stingy and greedy.‚Äù

original: bdag cag la sbyin par mi 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag cag la sbyin par mi 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that he does not want to give to us.

original: 'di ni glegs bam gyi chos 'di sbyin pa'i dbang med pa zhig yin gor ma chag ste /
analyzed: 'di ni glegs bam gyi chos 'di sbyin pa'i dbang med pa zhig yin gor ma chag ste /
translated: It is certain that he is unable to give this Dharma of the scriptures.

original: de'i phyir sbyin par mi byed do snyam du shes par byed de /üîΩ'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi sbyin pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin par mi byed do snyam du shes par byed de / 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi sbyin pa las brtsams te /
translated: Therefore, he does not give it.üîΩThis also is the generosity of the wise bodhisattva,

original: shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩgzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni chos dang zang zing gi rang bzhin gyi @183b sbyin pa thams cad ni rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang rab tu dbye ba las kyang /
analyzed: shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o // gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni chos dang zang zing gi rang bzhin gyi @183b sbyin pa thams cad ni rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang rab tu dbye ba las kyang /
translated: beginning with the gift of Dharma.üîΩMoreover, the bodhisattva gives the gift of Dharma and material gifts,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas sbyin par byed de /
translated: knowing them correctly as they are, through their synonyms, characteristics, etymologies, causes, effects, and divisions.

original: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This also is the generosity of the wise bodhisattva.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la ni byams pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la ni byams pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva gives gifts with a mind of loving kindness to sentient beings who do harm.

original: sdug bsngal ba rnams la ni snying rje'i bsam pa dang yon tan can rnams la ni dga' ba'i bsam pa dang / phan 'dogs pa rnams la ni mdza' bshes dang / snying du sdug pa rnams la ni btang snyoms kyi bsam pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams la ni snying rje'i bsam pa dang yon tan can rnams la ni dga' ba'i bsam pa dang / phan 'dogs pa rnams la ni mdza' bshes dang / snying du sdug pa rnams la ni btang snyoms kyi bsam pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: He gives gifts with a mind of compassion to those who are suffering, with a mind of joy to those who have good qualities, with a mind of equanimity to those who are helpful, and with a mind of equanimity to those who are dear.

original: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the wise bodhisattva‚Äôs giving.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa dang sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa'i gnyen po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa dang sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa'i gnyen po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva knows well the obstacles to giving and the antidotes to the obstacles to giving.

original: de la sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four obstacles to giving:

original: sngon ma goms pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos nyung ste mi ldan pa dang / dngos po mchog dang yid du 'ong ba la zhen pa dang / phyi ma la longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu la lta zhing mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sngon ma goms pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos nyung ste mi ldan pa dang / dngos po mchog dang yid du 'ong ba la zhen pa dang / phyi ma la longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu la lta zhing mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: The causes of stinginess are lack of prior habituation, having few or no objects to give, attachment to excellent or pleasing objects, and looking forward to and delighting in the result of perfect wealth in the future.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sbyin par bya ba'i chos dag yod bzhin du slong ba po legs par 'ongs pa na sbyin pa la sems mi 'jug na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sbyin par bya ba'i chos dag yod bzhin du slong ba po legs par 'ongs pa na sbyin pa la sems mi 'jug na /
translated: When bodhisattvas have objects to give and a beggar has properly appeared, if their minds do not turn to generosity,

original: de nyes pa 'di ni bdag ma goms pas lan no snyam du myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de nyes pa 'di ni bdag ma goms pas lan no snyam du myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: they quickly realize with their wisdom that the fault is their lack of prior habituation.

original: 'di ltar yang bdag gis sngon sbyin pa ma byin pa gor ma chag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang bdag gis sngon sbyin pa ma byin pa gor ma chag ste /
translated: They think, ‚ÄúIt is certain that I did not give in the past.

original: des na bdag de ltar longs spyod rnams kyang yod la slong pa po yang legs par 'ongs bzhin du sbyin pa la sems mi 'jug go //
analyzed: des na bdag de ltar longs spyod rnams kyang yod la slong pa po yang legs par 'ongs bzhin du sbyin pa la sems mi 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, even though I have wealth and a beggar has properly appeared, my mind does not turn to generosity.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar so sor brtags nas sbyin pa ma byas na phyi ma la yang bdag sbyin pa la zhe sdang bar 'gyur ro snyam du rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar so sor brtags nas sbyin pa ma byas na phyi ma la yang bdag sbyin pa la zhe sdang bar 'gyur ro snyam du rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If I do not give after examining in this way, I will be angry at giving in the future as well.

original: das de ltar rtogs nas kyang sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa'i gnyen po la brten nas so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: das de ltar rtogs nas kyang sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa'i gnyen po la brten nas so sor rtog ste /
translated: Having understood in this way, he gives after examining with the wisdom that relies on the antidote to the obstacle to giving.

original: sbyin par byed kyi ma goms pa las gyur pa'i nyes pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing de'i dbang du 'gro ba ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang gal te slong ba po legs par 'ongs @184a * //
analyzed: sbyin par byed kyi ma goms pa las gyur pa'i nyes pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing de'i dbang du 'gro ba ma yin no // gzhan yang gal te slong ba po legs par 'ongs @184a * //
translated: He does not follow the faults that arise from lack of familiarity with giving and does not fall under their power.

original: la longs spyod chung bas sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i sems mi 'jug na /
analyzed: la longs spyod chung bas sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i sems mi 'jug na /
translated: Moreover, if the thought of giving does not occur to the bodhisattva because of having little wealth to give to a beggar who has come,

original: des sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa'i rgyu phongs pa las gyur pa des myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs nas /
analyzed: des sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa'i rgyu phongs pa las gyur pa des myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs nas /
translated: he quickly realizes with wisdom that the cause of the obstacle to giving is poverty.

original: phongs pa las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal de dang du blangs te /
analyzed: phongs pa las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal de dang du blangs te /
translated: He accepts the suffering that arises from poverty.

original: so sor brtags nas snying rjes sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: so sor brtags nas snying rjes sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: Having examined it, he gives with compassion.

original: de 'di snyam du 'khor ba na pha rol la phan ma btags par sngon gyi las kyi nyes pa'am /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du 'khor ba na pha rol la phan ma btags par sngon gyi las kyi nyes pa'am /
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúIn cyclic existence, I have not helped others, and because of the fault of my past actions,

original: gzhan gyis dbang byas pas bdag gis bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad brlag pa mang du myong bar 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dbang byas pas bdag gis bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad brlag pa mang du myong bar 'gyur gyis /
translated: or because of being controlled by others, I have experienced many terrible sufferings of hunger, thirst, and so on.

original: gal te tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu sbyin pa las byung ba des bdag 'chi zhing dus byed par gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu sbyin pa las byung ba des bdag 'chi zhing dus byed par gyur du zin kyang /
translated: If I die in this life because of giving to others the suffering of this life that is the cause of helping others,

original: bdag la sbyin pa kho na legs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag la sbyin pa kho na legs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: it is better for me to give than not to give.

original: slong ba po phyir bzlog pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: slong ba po phyir bzlog pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not right to turn away a beggar.

original: de med du zin kyang kha cig sngo rngad ci yang rung ba tsam gyis 'tsho'o snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de med du zin kyang kha cig sngo rngad ci yang rung ba tsam gyis 'tsho'o snyam du sems te /
translated: Even if I do not have anything, I can live on just vegetables and so on.‚Äù

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' phongs pa las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal de dang du blangs nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' phongs pa las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal de dang du blangs nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva endures the suffering that comes from being in need and gives a gift.

original: gzhan yang slong ba po legs par 'ongs pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang slong ba po legs par 'ongs pa na /
translated: Moreover, when a beggar comes,

original: gal te sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po shas cher yid du 'ong zhing mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i sems mi 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po shas cher yid du 'ong zhing mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i sems mi 'jug na /
translated: If the bodhisattva's mind does not engage in generosity because the gift object is very pleasing and excellent,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhen pa las gyur pa'i nyes pa de myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhen pa las gyur pa'i nyes pa de myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs nas /
translated: that bodhisattva quickly realizes with wisdom that fault arising from attachment.

original: bdag sdug bsngal la bde ba'o snyam du bdag gi 'du shes phyin ci log pa 'di ni phyi ma la sdug bsngal ba bskyed pa yin no snyam du phyin ci log tu yongs su shes nas /
analyzed: bdag sdug bsngal la bde ba'o snyam du bdag gi 'du shes phyin ci log pa 'di ni phyi ma la sdug bsngal ba bskyed pa yin no snyam du phyin ci log tu yongs su shes nas /
translated: He thinks, This mistaken perception of mine that views suffering as happiness will generate suffering in the future.

original: de spangs te so sor brtags nas dngos po de sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de spangs te so sor brtags nas dngos po de sbyin par byed do //
translated: Having fully understood that mistake, he abandons it and, having examined it, gives that object.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de sbyin pa byin nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de sbyin pa byin nas /
translated: Moreover, that bodhisattva, having given a gift,

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po'i phan yon la lta bar gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po'i phan yon la lta bar gyur te /
translated: views the benefit of great wealth as the result of generosity,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phan yon la mi lta bar gyur na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phan yon la mi lta bar gyur na /
translated: but does not view the benefit of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpas log pa'i 'bras bu la lta ba las gyur pa'i nyes pa de myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas log pa'i 'bras bu la lta ba las gyur pa'i nyes pa de myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs nas /
translated: Bodhisattvas quickly understand and realize with their wisdom the faults that arise from the view of the results of wrong views.

original: 'du byed thams cad snying po med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor brtags te /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad snying po med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor brtags te /
translated: They examine and fully understand that all compounded phenomena are without essence.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni skad cig la 'jig pa'i ngang can no //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni skad cig la 'jig pa'i ngang can no //
translated: All compounded phenomena are momentary and perishable.

original: 'bras @184b bu longs spyad pa rnams ni yongs su zad nas 'jig pa'i ngang can dang 'bral bas 'jig pa'i ngang can no snyam ste /
analyzed: 'bras @184b bu longs spyad pa rnams ni yongs su zad nas 'jig pa'i ngang can dang 'bral bas 'jig pa'i ngang can no snyam ste /
translated: The results that have been enjoyed are perishable in that they are exhausted and perish, and they are perishable in that one is separated from them.

original: de de ltar so sor rtog pa na 'bras bu la lta ba spangs nas sbyin pa gang ci sbyin pa yang rung te /
analyzed: de de ltar so sor rtog pa na 'bras bu la lta ba spangs nas sbyin pa gang ci sbyin pa yang rung te /
translated: When they examine them in this way, they give up the view of the results and whatever gifts they give

original: de thams cad byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa kho nas sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: de thams cad byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa kho nas sbyin par byed de /
translated: they dedicate them all exclusively to great enlightenment.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la gegs byed pa rnam pa bzhi dang / sbyin pa la gegs byed pa'i gnyen po rnam pa bzhi shes pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la gegs byed pa rnam pa bzhi dang / sbyin pa la gegs byed pa'i gnyen po rnam pa bzhi shes pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as the four obstacles to the bodhisattva's giving and the four remedies for the obstacles to giving.

original: rtogs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / phyin ci log yongs su shes pa dang / 'du byed la snying po med pa nyid du lta ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / phyin ci log yongs su shes pa dang / 'du byed la snying po med pa nyid du lta ba'o //
translated: realization, the acceptance of suffering, the thorough knowledge of error, and the view of the insubstantiality of compounded things.

original: de la gnyen po shes pa snga ma rnam pa gsum gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' nges par legs par sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de la gnyen po shes pa snga ma rnam pa gsum gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' nges par legs par sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: By means of the first three knowledges of remedies, the bodhisattva gives gifts with full awareness.

original: gnyen po shes pa tha ma gcig gis ni yang dag pa'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: gnyen po shes pa tha ma gcig gis ni yang dag pa'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: By means of the last single knowledge of remedies, he takes up the fruit of true merit.

original: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the wise bodhisattva's giving.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni dben par song ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni dben par song ste /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva, having gone to a solitary place,

original: nang du bsdus nas bsam pa dag cing snying thag pa nas dang bas kun du rtog pa dag gis sbyin par bya ba'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs rgya chen po dpag tu med pa dag mos shing sems can rnams la sbyin pa bstabs par 'dod de /
analyzed: nang du bsdus nas bsam pa dag cing snying thag pa nas dang bas kun du rtog pa dag gis sbyin par bya ba'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs rgya chen po dpag tu med pa dag mos shing sems can rnams la sbyin pa bstabs par 'dod de /
translated: Having gathered them together, with a pure mind, with a pure thought from the very depths of his heart, he believes in the various kinds of generosity, the vast and immeasurable gifts of the Dharma, and he wishes to give them to beings.

original: des byang chub sems dpa' tshogs chung ngus bsod nams dpag tu med pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa' tshogs chung ngus bsod nams dpag tu med pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through this, the bodhisattva, with little difficulty, increases his merit immeasurably.

original: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin par rig par 'gyur te /
translated: This is also the generosity of the bodhisattva who is wise,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can shes rab chen po dang ldan pa'i shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can shes rab chen po dang ldan pa'i shes rab can gyi sbyin pa yin no //
translated: This is the generosity of the bodhisattva who is wise, who is endowed with great wisdom, who is wise.

original: de ltar mdor bsdu na zang zing gi sbyin par gtogs pa'i sbyin par bya ba'i chos bdog pa rnams dang / mi bdog pa rnams dang / de bzhin du chos kyi sbyin pa la brten pa dang / so sor yang dag par rig pa la brten pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bsdu na zang zing gi sbyin par gtogs pa'i sbyin par bya ba'i chos bdog pa rnams dang / mi bdog pa rnams dang / de bzhin du chos kyi sbyin pa la brten pa dang / so sor yang dag par rig pa la brten pa dang /
translated: Thus, in brief, the generosity of the bodhisattva is to be understood as being of six kinds: the generosity of giving external things, the generosity of giving internal things, the generosity of giving both internal and external things, the generosity of giving the Dharma, the generosity of giving the analytical knowledges,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa la brten pa dang / sbyin pa la gegs byed pa'i gnyen po shes pa la brten pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas mos pa'i sbyin pa la brten pa ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa la brten pa dang / sbyin pa la gegs byed pa'i gnyen po shes pa la brten pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas mos pa'i sbyin pa la brten pa ni /
translated: the generosity of giving pure superior attitude, the generosity of giving the antidote to the obstacles to generosity, and the generosity of giving superior attitude.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kho na'i ma 'dres pa yin par rig par bya ste /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i nang dang @185a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kho na'i ma 'dres pa yin par rig par bya ste / byang chub sems dpa'i nang dang @185a * //
translated: These six kinds of generosity are to be understood as the unique generosity of the bodhisattva.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad sbyin pa'i rab tu dbye ba rgyas pa ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad sbyin pa'i rab tu dbye ba rgyas pa ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattva is to be understood as being of these kinds, and as being of other kinds, in brief and in detail.

original: 'di man chad dka' ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa gzhan thams cad ni thams cad kyang sbyin pa 'di nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di man chad dka' ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa gzhan thams cad ni thams cad kyang sbyin pa 'di nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
